words.definition: If a room or building is adjoining, it is next to or joined to another one.
words.example: We stayed in adjoining rooms at the hotel.

words.definition: To allege something means to say that it is true without having proof.
words.example: The police allege that he was at the scene of the crime.

words.definition: An arch is a curved structure that supports the weight of something above it.
words.example: The bridge has a beautiful stone arch.

words.definition: To assemble means to come together in one place or to put parts together.
words.example: A large crowd assembled in the square to hear the speech.

words.definition: A casualty is a person who is killed or injured in a war or accident.
words.example: There were many casualties in the earthquake.

words.definition: To erect something means to build or put up a structure.
words.example: The workers erected a new fence around the garden.

words.definition: If something is foul, it has a very unpleasant smell or taste.
words.example: There was a foul smell coming from the garbage can.

words.definition: A hectare is a unit of measurement for land equal to 10,000 square meters.
words.example: The farm covers ten hectares of land.

words.definition: To heighten something means to increase its intensity or level.
words.example: The music helped to heighten the tension in the movie.

words.definition: Hospitality is the friendly and generous treatment of guests.
words.example: We were very grateful for the hospitality shown by our hosts.

words.definition: A mansion is a very large and expensive house.
words.example: The movie star lives in a huge mansion in Hollywood.

words.definition: To outnumber something means to be greater in number than it.
words.example: The students outnumber the teachers in the classroom.

words.definition: If you are overjoyed, you are extremely happy about something.
words.example: She was overjoyed to hear that she had won the contest.

words.definition: A pasture is a field covered with grass that is suitable for animals to eat.
words.example: The cows were grazing in the green pasture.

words.definition: A petition is a formal document signed by many people asking for change.
words.example: The citizens signed a petition to stop the building of the new road.

words.definition: To renovate something means to repair and improve an old building.
words.example: They decided to renovate their kitchen and add new appliances.

words.definition: To revise something means to change it in order to improve it.
words.example: The author had to revise the book before it could be published.

words.definition: A slab is a thick, flat piece of a hard material such as stone or wood.
words.example: The table was made from a single slab of marble.

words.definition: A terrace is a flat area outside a building where people can sit.
words.example: We had dinner on the terrace overlooking the sea.

words.definition: Turf is a layer of grass and the soil beneath it.
words.example: The workers laid new turf on the football field.
